By lovesaurian on Wednesday, June 14, 2000 - 10:10 am:

I was just wondering what happened when you got to this year. Does the game end (please no) or do the yrs go back to 1000 or 0? does it just get stuck at 9999? Or... mebbe it goes to 10000. I am not anywere near this, just curious if anyone knows...

By Tony on Wednesday, June 14, 2000 - 02:07 pm:

By Nate Railsback on Thursday, June 15, 2000 - 01:35 pm:

By Nate Railsback on Monday, July 31, 2000 - 06:50 pm:

Basically, my argument was that as far as I can tell, there are only 4 digits reserved in the line of code that records the date. This means that with those four digits maxed out (FFFF), the date would be somewhere around 2600. However, when I tried this out, the game seemed to double-apply the code and I wound up in the 5000's. I don't know how it go up this high, unless there was another line of code to record another digit, and I couldn't find one in any likely places. Hence, I'm confused and don't know the answer.

By AlphaFAT2 on Tuesday, January 30, 2001 - 09:11 pm:

I know the problem. FFFF in decimal is 65535 is 5535 what you seen? try with the input of 270F which comes to 9999 in decimal. Hey use the calculator on the comp and put it into sci-mode and just switch between hex and dec.

By AlphaFAT2 on Thursday, February 1, 2001 - 01:57 pm:

By Lisa Shock on Friday, August 3, 2001 - 01:50 pm:

Sorry, the gist was that the guy had used a gameshark to boost the date of his game to 9999. I hope I remember this correctly, but I think he said the game would simply stop and the start-up screen would appear, giving him the option of starting a new game, or re-living that last week. At any rate, 9999 is the final week, so plan ahead and split your saves off ahead of time!
